meanings.definition: The observable physical characteristics of an organism resulting from the interaction of its genotype with the environment.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study different phenotypes in animals to understand how genes and the environment influence appearance.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper noticed the unique phenotypes of the new baby panda.
meanings.sent3: The phenotypes of the chameleon made it look like it was wearing a colorful costume.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of plain flowers, the vibrant phenotype of the orchid stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the intricate phenotypes of the butterfly in stunning detail.
